Package sketch.compiler.controlflow

Control-flow and data-flow analysis for the StreamIt front-end IR.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Lattice
    An element in a well-formed lattice structure.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AnyTypeLattice
    Base class for lattices that track a type.
    CFG
    A control-flow graph.
    CFGBuilder
    Helper class to build a control-flow graph from linear code.
    CFGNode
    A single-statement or single-expression node in a control flow graph.
    CFGNode.EdgePair  
    CountLattice
    Simple lattice that counts something.
    DataFlow
    Abstract base class for data-flow analyses.
    StatementCounter
    Data-flow analysis to count the number of times some qualifying statement appears in a CFG.
    StrictTypeLattice
    Type-tracking lattice that requires that types match exactly.

Package sketch.compiler.controlflow Description

Control-flow and data-flow analysis for the StreamIt front-end IR. Data-flow analysis is important for several applications, and is used by the front-end's semantic checker to verify correctness of types in pipelines. streamit.frontend.controlflow.CFG provides an immutable control-flow graph representation for a function, which is built by streamit.frontend.controlflow.CFGBuilder#buildCFG. The graph is built up of streamit.frontend.controlflow.CFGNodes, each of which contains at most one statement or expression.

Data-flow analyses have two parts. A generic engine is provided in the streamit.frontend.controlflow.DataFlow class; actual analyses are derived from this class, and must provide the initial lattice value and a flow function. Lattice values are derived from streamit.frontend.controlflow.Lattice.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
David Maze <dmaze@cag.lcs.mit.edu>
